page.title: 13Life in Erbistock, 1953
page.content: Erbistock is a rural area,the majority of people were engaged in agriculture. The parish was dominated by Erbistock and Manley Hall.The majority of houses were cottages tied to the estates. There were no council houses.Services were few. There was no electricity and no piped water.Water was obtained from a tap fed by a well.When the well ran dry, water was collected from the River Dee.Most people used an open cooking range.Most people worked on the estates which supported craftsmen like hedgers and wheelwrights, as well as the usual farming jobs.Bicycles were popular as there were few cars. Many people went to Wrexham by bus for shopping.Mobile shops and a paraffin seller came weekly.Sunday church attendance was more or less compulsory due to the dependence of the community on the local gentry.
